body.name: Olay Facial Cleanser for Sensitive Skin, Fragrance-free, 6.7 Fl Oz
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 7 hrs 5 mins
features: SENSITIVE FACIAL CLEANSER: Rinse away daily toxins and calm stressed, dry skin
CALMING CLEANSE: This feather-light cleanser is dermatologically tested and found to be gentle on skin
SOAP & FRAGRANCE-FREE: Designed to help fight dry skin at the source
DEFEND AGAINST STRESSED SKIN: Formulated with a leading dermatologist-recommended moisturizing ingredient to give skin’s natural moisture a boost
AM & PM: Use morning and night before your favorite moisturizer or treatment
GENTLE CLEAN: Olay’s formula gently cleans skin with non-stripping cleansers
body.description: Introducing Olay Sensitive - a dermatologically tested skin care line developed to calm dry, stressed skin. Olay Sensitive Calming Liquid Fragrance-Free Facial Cleanser is soap-free and dye-free, so it's gentle on skin. This feather-light, fragrance-free face wash rinses away toxins and drenches skin in hydration. Thanks to Olay's cleansing formula, inspired by skin, it lifts away dirt with non-stripping cleansers and acts as a sensitive skin makeup remover. Thanks to ingredients naturally derived from sunflowers and other plants, Olay Sensitive helps fight dry skin at the source and lets you enjoy a calming clean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I've tried many different cleansers over the years and I've never found something that worked well for me. I've got weird sensitive combination skin. I bought this stuff just to try it. I am impressed! My skin feels so nice and it doesn't make me feel too dry. It smells amazing too.I just stocked up on this stuff because it's definitely worth it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: When I used this cleanser and rinsed it off my skin felt moisturized and so soft a Wonderful cleanser

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love the smell and it’s really cleared my face!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Calms my Rosacea
reviews.reviewText: This review is for the calming moisturizer in the jar - NOT the cleanser in the pump bottle. I started having rosacea in my mid-30's and have tried almost every redness reducing product on the market. This is the ONLY moisturizer that clears and calms my skin. Not too heavy, not oily, no fragrance and even works well around my eyes. This product is now my go-to moisturizer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My new holy grail cleanser
reviews.reviewText: I have sensitive skin and my skin will burn with other cleansers. But this one doesn’t do that. I have always gotten in the habit of putting on my cleanser in the shower quickly but gently rubbing all over my face and then immediately rinsing it off because if I leave it on too long my skin starts BURNING. After a successful first run, I decided to test this one’s limits even further and left it on my skin longer and decided to take my time like a normal person and was pleasantly surprised to not experience any burning sensation at all.The scent is a bit strong in my opinion, especially for a cleanser aimed for sensitive skin but it is still pleasant. The consistency is that of a light lotion and it is really easy to apply and work on your face and easy to remove as well.This cleanser is my new holy grail. So cheap, doesn’t burn during application and leaves my face feeling clean and soft afterwards.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Strange smell - smells like it was burnt? It’s odd. Texture is fine, though product isn’t that effective — but it doesn’t harm my sensitive skin either. Just overall ineffective.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lives up to its name
reviews.reviewText: I have dry sensitive skin and rosacea, tho not bad. I have tried all sorts of mosturizers, and usually they sting a little (the anti aging ones especially, lucky me). This one truly is calming! That's the best word I can use to describe it. A little goes a long way - if I use too much, it leaves a coating on my skin. Not a big deal, but probably a waste of product. I have noticed that it soothes my skin, helps with redness, softens my face. After much searching, this is it for me!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great face wash
reviews.reviewText: Excellent for my sensitive skin, smells great and the price is amazing. I just purchased another one

It's not a bad cream but it's definitely better for maybe dry skin.. I wanted to use this because I use actives that leave my skin feeling dry but this cream gave me bumpy texture didn't break me out badly small flare-up but many tiny bumps.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for those who aren't acne prone
reviews.reviewText: This did lessen the red in my face and overall was calming. However I found it congested my pores and didn't spread liberally - a bit thick for my taste. And not that moisturizing either. For those who aren't acne prone and anti redness is their main concern, I'd recommend.

This is a nice moisturizer that arrives in an easy to open box, with a container that's both easy to open and close.This is great for sensitive skin and those with scent sensitivities, as it's not packed with scents.The name of calming moisturizer is an accurate description, as it helps with dry skin quite a bit, and didn't irritate even sensitive skin. After a week of use I didn't experience any breakouts, which some products do.Since there's no SPF, I don't suggest to use this as a day cream. Additionally, it takes awhile to sink in, so not ideal for most people's morning routines.Overall a nice night cream, but I find this to be way too expensive for an Olay product; most people that are loyal to Olay do not have the budget to purchase this product. Keeping it closer to the $10 mark would help more people with sensitivities who are on a tight income.

My dry skin has really been bad this year - it usually works around the heating in our apartment and this year, my skin really started acting up.There are two things that make me a fan of this cream. 1) there are so many chemically enhanced ingredients that have been removed. I love it. Often times, when you remove so many ingredients, the product ends up not working very well, but this is not the case here.The 2nd thing that I love is the fact that this cream feels like a cloud. It is so soft on applilcation and you only need a little bit. My skin has started absorbing this cream and my dry patches are slowly going away.
